Make budget appropriation conditional on ICE reform
  • Visit Burlington ICE office every 3 months.
  • Officer Identification & Accountability: Require ICE officers to wear visible name tags or ID numbers, document all operations, and allow independent oversight of concealed identities.
  • American Family Protection: Protect non-violent immigrants closely related to U.S. citizens from deportation, keeping families together.
  • Fair Asylum Assessment: No blanket asylum bans by nationality; every case should be judged individually and fairly.
  • Human Rights Protection: No deportations to countries where people could face torture, persecution, or death. Judges must consider official U.S. government reports on country conditions.
  • Language Access Rights: Guarantee free, certified interpreters during immigration arrests and questioning.
  • Immigration Court Reform: Hire more judges, update technology, and reduce case backlogs for a fairer, faster process.
